comments:
This class is an introduction to sociology and examines human behavior and social interactions. In the class, social structures are examined as well as the creation, maintenance and changes of culture and how they affect individuals. 
Students felt that material in this class was very “interesting” and “eye opening.”  A few students even said that it made them “consider sociology as a potential major.”  However, students commented that the professor had taught the material for a different class (SOCI-002) making the recitations pointless. 
The students felt that Professor Jacobs was an “awesome professor” and that he “is quite good at lecturing.”  However, students commented that the instructions of the papers “were unclear, especially for students who have never written sociology paper before.”
This class is an introductory class, taken mostly by underclassman.  This was also taken by some students looking to fill sector requirements.
